snippet.textDisplay: After having this game sealed for so long, I am finally looking forward to playing this after I'm done with Xenoblade (Yes, I'm still playing it. I restarted the game on the Dolphin emulator, looks great! I post progress updates on twitter/fb). It looks like plain good fun and as a fan of Zelda, I'd be surprised if I didn't enjoy it. By the way, this was made by Silicon Studio who are also behind the Bravely Default series.
snippet.textOriginal: After having this game sealed for so long, I am finally looking forward to playing this after I'm done with Xenoblade (Yes, I'm still playing it. I restarted the game on the Dolphin emulator, looks great! I post progress updates on twitter/fb). It looks like plain good fun and as a fan of Zelda, I'd be surprised if I didn't enjoy it. By the way, this was made by Silicon Studio who are also behind the Bravely Default series.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky I played it probably about half way and got bored. Other than the art it didn't really have anything to hold me.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky I played it probably about half way and got bored. Other than the art it didn't really have anything to hold me.

snippet.textDisplay:
+SupraDarky 
Definitly one of my favorite games on PS3. The swords and upgrading mechanic sticks out the most to me. They could've just gone the Zelda route completely and give you two or three swords throughout the game but what they did was quite unique in itself in my opinion. The game took me back to the times where I was playing Alundra or Zelda on my Gameboy. Loveletter at it's finest, I just hope that someday it might get a PC release :)
snippet.textOriginal:
+SupraDarky 
Definitly one of my favorite games on PS3. The swords and upgrading mechanic sticks out the most to me. They could've just gone the Zelda route completely and give you two or three swords throughout the game but what they did was quite unique in itself in my opinion. The game took me back to the times where I was playing Alundra or Zelda on my Gameboy. Loveletter at it's finest, I just hope that someday it might get a PC release :)

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky one of the better zelda clones, I got pretty far but got stuck in one of the later temples and never ended up playing it again. Wasn't this also by From Software too? (Dark souls/Monster Hunter) There aren't much games from them that aren't good.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky one of the better zelda clones, I got pretty far but got stuck in one of the later temples and never ended up playing it again. Wasn't this also by From Software too? (Dark souls/Monster Hunter) There aren't much games from them that aren't good.

snippet.textDisplay: +Nuahsy I'm enjoying it so far, but probably quite less than most people judging from the reception it got. The amazing world (one of the best I've ever seen in a video game) and intriguing story makes up for the fact that I feel like I'm playing an offline MMO.
snippet.textOriginal: +Nuahsy I'm enjoying it so far, but probably quite less than most people judging from the reception it got. The amazing world (one of the best I've ever seen in a video game) and intriguing story makes up for the fact that I feel like I'm playing an offline MMO.
